pageContext.claim: “I hear that the governor [of Michigan] has gone all out for it, from being totally opposed to it [hydroxychloroquine]. Now she's all out for it. So that's what I'm hearing. So that's a good thing.”
pageContext.analysis: Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan was never "totally opposed" nor "all out for" hydroxychloroquine. The Michigan health department initially issued an advisory to medical providers, warning them not to stockpile hydroxychloroquine because of then-open questions about its legitimacy in treating coronavirus cases. Then, Michigan officials pursued a request for hydroxychloroquine from the national stockpile when the FDA approved the drug for limited use in clinical trials.
